info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 2:44PM CST until January 30 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. * WHERE...North Central Arkansas. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 7 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to a wintry mix tonight. A mix of freezing rain and sleet is expected. Ice accumulation will be less than one tenth of an inch.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow...sleet...or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for slippery roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. Be sure to check road conditions before traveling in these areas. Visit the Arkansas Department of Transportation`s website Idrivearkansas.com for the latest road and traffic conditions. For more information from the National Weather Service visit http://weather.gov/lzk
